Row.Text: Stupa

Can only be built in cities following a religion with the Stupas belief. Construct this building by purchasing it with [ICON_PEACE] Faith. Build the Stupa to gain Faith and, once you have researched Architecture, Tourism in the City.
A stupa is a mound-like or hemispherical structure containing Buddhist relics, typically the ashes of Buddhist monks, used by Buddhists as a place of meditation.

+4 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism once you have researched Architecture. Reduces [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] Illiteracy. Boosts Pressure of [ICON_RELIGION] Religious Majority emanating from this city by 25%, and increases the city's resistance to conversion by 20%.
Church

Can only be built in cities following a religion with the Churches belief. Construct this building by purchasing it with [ICON_PEACE] Faith. Build the Church to gain Faith and a Great Work of Music slot in the City. Also makes missionaries more effective.

A church building, often simply called a church, is a building used for religious activities, particularly worship services. The term in its architectural sense is most often used by Christians to refer to their religious buildings but can be used by other religions. In traditional Christian architecture, the church is often arranged in the shape of a Christian cross. When viewed from plan view the longest part of a cross is represented by the aisle and the junction of the cross is located at the altar area.

Reduces [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] Boredom. Boosts Pressure of [ICON_RELIGION] Religious Majority emanating from this city by 50%, and increases the city's resistance to conversion by 20%. All Missionaries born in this City can spread Religion three times.
Mandir

Can only be built in cities following a religion with the Mandirs belief. Construct this building by purchasing it with [ICON_PEACE] Faith. Build the Mandir to gain Faith, Food, and a Great Work of Music slot in the City. Protects your City from certain Advanced Spy Actions.
A Hindu temple is a house of god(s). It is a space and structure designed to bring human beings and gods together, infused with symbolism to express the ideas and beliefs of Hinduism.

Reduces [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] Poverty. +5% [ICON_FOOD] Food in the City. Boosts Pressure of [ICON_RELIGION] Religious Majority emanating from this city by 25%, and increases the city's resistance to conversion by 20%. Enemy [ICON_SPY] Spies in this City cannot assassinate [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People or disrupt Unit [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Synagogue

Can only be built in cities following a religion with the Synagogues belief. Construct this building by purchasing it with [ICON_PEACE] Faith. Build the Synagogue to gain Faith, Production, and a Great Work of Writing slot in the City. The City generates more Science during 'We Love the King Day.'

A synagogue, also spelled synagog, is a Jewish house of prayer. Synagogues have a large hall for prayer (the main sanctuary), and may also have smaller rooms for study and sometimes a social hall and offices. Some have a separate room for Torah study, called the beth midrash.

Reduces [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] Crime. Boosts Pressure of [ICON_RELIGION] Religious Majority emanating from this city by 25%, and increases the city's resistance to conversion by 20%. During 'We Love the King Day', City [ICON_RESEARCH] Science increases by +15%.
Order

Can only be built in cities following a religion with the Orders belief. Construct this building by purchasing it with [ICON_PEACE] Faith. Build the Order to gain Faith, additional City Hit Points and [ICON_STRENGTH] Strength, +10 XP for Military units, and the Morale promotion for your land units.

+10 XP and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Morale[ENDCOLOR] promotion for land Military units produced in this city. Grants additional City Hit Points and [ICON_STRENGTH] Strength. Reduces [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] Crime. Boosts Pressure of [ICON_RELIGION] Religious Majority emanating from this city by 25%, and increases the city's resistance to conversion by 20%.

A military order is any one of a variety of Christian societies of knights that were founded from the Middle Ages onwards for the purpose of crusading â€“ propagating or defending the faith (originally Catholic, and after the Reformation sometimes Protestant), either in the Holy Land or against Islam (as, for example, during the Reconquista) or pagans (mainly in the Baltic region) in Europe. Many orders have, since the end of the Crusades and the Ottoman incursions, become secularized, and are usually represented by Roman Catholic ceremonial, missionary and charitable organizations in modern times.

Reduces [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] Poverty. Boosts Pressure of [ICON_RELIGION] Religious Majority emanating from this city by 25%, and increases the city's resistance to conversion by 20%. Farms near this City generate +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
